website_summaries.verdict: The perfect hose to use in the garden or for larger jobs. It is our pick for the best on the market today.
pros: Its rugged yet flexible design makes it ideal for small and big jobs
Coils easily in all weather conditions
Has anodized aluminum fittings that are built to last
cons: While its flexible construction makes it easy to use in most settings, it occasionally develops a kink

customer_reviews.title: This hose has a BIG problem that is not being addressed by the manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I've now had a chance to see a neighbors hose with 6 months of typical use around his house. The hose had changed from day-glow green, to a muddy, black-spotted, moldy mess that rubs off on your hands. I initially missed the critical reviews that provided pictures and accurate descriptions of what I would have experienced in a few months. Additionally, I understand that the warranty for the hose will not be honored by the manufacturer if a claim is made because of the mold. Amazon needs to assess it's customers' experience with this product and the manufacturer's total lack of transparency about the mold issue.
customer_reviews.author: Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive, and i'm not sure why! Leaked immediately.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like my new hose. It seemed really cool, lightweight, and different than any hose I've ever had prior. That's about the extent of it. This leaked from the swivel grip the first time i tightened it to my hose bib. I've tried Teflon tape for the threads even and its leaking below that - where the hose connects hose end at the swivel. I'm left wondering why this hose is so expensive when its really this terrible - i could have spent half as much and been less disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: Hose fell apart on the faucet side after only a few uses. Past the normal return date cause with all the rain we've had, haven't had to use it much. Amazon did make an exception for this hose though. I just wouldn't expect a $37 hose to fall apart so easily. 8/162018 Update - Second hose fell apart. What a terrible waste of money and Amazon won't take this one back. You DON'T get what you pay for here.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mckee

customer_reviews.title: Untrustworthy connector
customer_reviews.text: After only a few months of service, the grip end popped off, rendering the hose useless and releasing gallons of water. What a disappointment because I really liked this flexible hose despite its relative expensiveness. I now won’t be able to trust my remaining Flexilla hoses and regret my investment in them.
customer_reviews.author: Grohappy

customer_reviews.title: SwivelGrip fails, leaks and product is complely useless.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple of weeks then slowly started dripping at the "Swivel Grip", completeof waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flexible, lightweight, swivel ends reduce hose diameter, made in Taiwan
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Lightweight but not flimsy, easy to carry (25' version) - Swivel ends work well, making it easy to attach/detach hose from bib and fittings - Relatively kink- free and easy to roll up and unroll without tangling - Bright color makes it easy to spot if you leave it in the grass or weeds - Swivel hose end fittings reduce the 5/8 inch hose diameter to 7/16 inch, but there is no noticeable reduction in water flow - Not made in comm't China - Price is reasonable for the quality Cons: - Other Flexzilla hoses I've bought have discolored some, but not terribly so, as I keep them in a covered hose reel - Made in Taiwan
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: My favorite garden hose despite problems
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about my Flexzilla hose despite some problems which I will elaborate on. What I love: • The color • It weighs a lot less than my rubber hose • Kinks less than my rubber hose • I leave it out and full of water all winter. I live in zone 6 and need to hose off my wheelchair wheels before coming into my house • I can drink out of it, but I never have... What I don't like: • The attached photos show what was mentioned by another reviewer. This beautiful green hose •
customer_reviews.author: Vermillion

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst hoses i have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst hoses i have ever purchased. Description said 'non-kink' and it kinks worse than any hose I've owned. Maybe if I spent the money on a hose reel, it wouldn't be so bad, but trying to coil it in a hose basket is murder. It doesn't go back easily from wence it came and ulling it back out it constantly kinks! DO NOT BUY if you want a hos e that's easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: C Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Best Darn Garden Hose
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and medium light weight hose. Actually best darn hose I ever purchased. The swivel grip makes this hose wrangle extremely easy in the yard
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Leaks immediately-poor design and construction flaw
customer_reviews.text: Installed the hose and I do enjoy the swivel grip although I suspect that this convenience is the cause of the leak itself. Within the female end that connects to the spigot it leaks persistently. For such a heavy and expensive hose you would assume that the seals are welded correctly but that is not the case. Contacted the Seller and they only allow 30 days for return so make sure you connect it immediately to ensure there are no leaks. You can find better drinking water hoses for half the price. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: E C

customer_reviews.title: I received the hose 12/31/17. Today--3/4/18-- the connector broke ...
customer_reviews.text: I received the hose 12/31/17. Today--3/4/18-- the connector broke. I would give it a zero star if that was a choice
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Easily cracks-not for country terrain.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After two months of use (just watering plants at foundation of my home) the hose cracked. Very disappointed. I bought two 100 feet hoses because I may need them both for to control a burn pile. The deadline to return both is past. Hopefully rubber cement and pieces of rubber will fix the crack. My precious 4 star rating is now a one star.
customer_reviews.author: Becky F.

customer_reviews.title: Great hose for dangerous situation
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hose on April 20, 2017. I have had this hose at FULL PRESSURE - IN MY HOME - FOR 3 YEARS! I have a VERY unique situation. I have dedicated one room of my apartment to being a plant growing room. When I purchased this hose it was because it had such incredible reviews. In fact, it consistently was at the top of lists for being the most dependable hose available, that’s why I purchased it. I wanted the convenience of being able to leave the hose on all the time. I know it’s risky but my plan worked. This hose has never leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had as much luck as everyone else
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this hose. Work 3 times. The swivel grip fell off. The end for attachments is connected to the hose with a barbed type fitting then clamped on. While using the hose the end just shot off from the rest off the hose. I can't clamp it to fix it because it will create an oval and cause leaking. I also had the black moldy growth that others have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: This hose leaked right out of the packaging. Ridiculous ...
customer_reviews.text: This hose leaked right out of the packaging. Ridiculous. Leaks from within the dark green handle. Tightened perfectly and with teflon tape no leaks from the threads. The leaking is from behind the connection within the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Annoying to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm not impressed so far. The hose is light and easy to pull around. And the couplings are nice. But that's the end of its good qualities. It seemingly wants to stay in a permanent coil. Maybe from the way it was packaged. I've had it unpackaged for several weeks and it still wants to coil. When you pull it straight the coils link. The hose is very difficult to use and kinks very easily. It definitely is going lto hose heaven early. Additonal review - I'm going to donate this hose to someone I hate. It's 75' of misery first when you uncoil it ź and then again when you attempt to recoil it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Flexzilla my rear axle!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, unit is light, big plus for 75' hose. A better name than flexzilla would have been twistzilla! It was a real battle just to get it unwarped, untwisted and wound on wall hanger. After hanging on hose wall hanger for a few days I went to use it today and again I had to untwist it from hanger! Is there a secret to using the dang thing? My frustation level is pretty low, as my wife tells me, But damn playing twister every time is nuts. Good luck to future buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Garesfun

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Several months of use without a kink or problem. The hard part is uncoiling it the first time out of the package. I did uncoil it carefully on a warm day. I'm experienced with flipping hoses around as they uncoil, when they have a mind of their own, but this was still a challenge for me! Once uncoiled, though, it's had several months of use and abuse without a problem. I debated about spending more for the SwivelGrip model, but I'm glad I did! It really does make it easier to attach and disconnect with the arthritis in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Ape

customer_reviews.title: Best hose I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Best hose I ever bought! I first purchased the 100' hose without the swivel grip in order to save money. I needed to get an additional hose so I felt like splurging a little to try the swivel grip out. Wow, I regret not getting it on the 100' hose! It is definitely worth the extra money to get that option. It makes connecting and disconnecting the hose a pleasure. I highly recommend the swivel grip.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Just blew apart
customer_reviews.text: *Update* I called Flexzilla and they replaced my hose with no issues. So change from 1 star to 4 for now! Well i just got done telling the neighbors what nice hoses these were and the connector popped right out. i have the 100 footer and bought this swivel version shorty to put on the end so its easier to move around. Oh and i see i cant return it so lets see if someone from flexzilla chimes in on a house ive had for a month and it failed.
customer_reviews.author: jfrigo

customer_reviews.title: Very poor hose!
customer_reviews.text: This hose is heavy, stains easily, even after first use, and is very hard to coil. It likes to tangle itself up, and cuts off the flow of water. I do not recommend it! It gets a two thumbs down rating!
customer_reviews.author: Phil Leftwich

customer_reviews.title: HOSE TURNS BLACK
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but flexible hose. After about a year the hose turned black. No Clorox or other available chemical treatment seemed to help. I live in Southern Louisiana; warm moist climates obviously present serious problems for this particular hose. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: music lover

customer_reviews.title: For the price, hose should last at least a year...
customer_reviews.text: Love this hose, but unfortunately it was short lived. This hose was babied and sat on covered Suncast reel since receiving it last year. Despite this, a hole was formed about a foot away from the end piece somehow. I do not believe any where else is damaged, so maybe i got a defective hose where wall of hose was thinner in that one spot. All i know is that for over $80.00, i should not have to find a replacement this soon.
customer_reviews.author: maria duran

customer_reviews.title: Don't ignore the reviews like I did
customer_reviews.text: Some of the review mentioned tangle and twist but the good reviews out weighted the bad ones. Well on initial opening it took almost an hour to untwist the 75-foot hose. Then when i moves it from one side of the house to the others side 3 kinks. I guess maybe with a hose reel it wont tangle or kink. Lets see how it goes through the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Coach CJ

customer_reviews.title: Kinks and flattens
customer_reviews.text: This hose is horrible. It both kinks and flattens out, impeding the water flow. I bought it to use with sprinklers and even with good water flow and a down hill drainage, because the hose flattens out, there wasn't enough water pressure to make my rainbird sprinkler function as effectively as it does with my other hoses. It also kinks and flattens so badly that it is almost useless with a hose hutch. I would not buy it again and I don't recommend it at all. I bought several. If I am still within my time limit, I am thinking about returning them all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR ME
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a hose that remained flexible in cold weather. In So. California that's 50 degrees. Here we water year around. This product performs as described. The anti kink end handles are great. 1/2 inch hose is reduced to 3/8 at each end. This does NOT affect water pressure. It would affect quantity of water flow, but I'm just watering a flower bed, washing the car, hosing the walkway, etc. The reduction in flow is negligible, I recommend this product which I've been looking for years. Not found in the big box stores nor the hardware stores I've been to.
customer_reviews.author: Topper Movius

customer_reviews.title: EXTRA KINKY
customer_reviews.text: ....and not in a fun way. To be fair, I do not have a pressure regulator on my spigot, but I have never encountered a hose that kinks more than this one! Every few feet, it folded back on itself, cutting off the water supply. The pressure made the hose coil around itself constantly. It was a nightmare! I will save this hose only for areas of my property with a pressure regulator, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: Hose became sticky.
customer_reviews.text: The hose works great and seamed to add additional pressure to the water. Has good construction and kinking is almost no existent. Not that easy to handle. Bought Aug of 2019 over time the hose got really sticky. I scrubbed it off with simple green and a green scrub pad. Would like to know if it reacts with chemicals or something to create this stickiness. Otherwise, this is a nice hose but hard to handle and your hands become covered in goo. I do not recommend this hose
customer_reviews.author: Frank48

customer_reviews.title: It Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I hooked up this hose and it leaks under the swivel grip to which the sprinkler attaches. The swivel handles are great and make attaching the hose to the faucet and sprinkler very easy. It's too bad it leaked. Now I have to take it all down, drain the hose, put it back in the box, print the label and take it to a UPS store. I don't think I will ever order a hose again from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: The Docster

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love the swivel handle, we've had a different flexzilla for a year and really like it, so purchased this one. The swivel handle is great, we had hesitations about it initially but it doesn't slip when you're screwing attachments on because it's molded around the end of the hose. Super easy to unkink with a flick of the hose end. light weight and seems to be durable after spending a year out in the hot CO sun on the south side of the house. Color has faded quite a bit on the old one, no mold issues like mentioned in other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Flexzilla hoses, drinking water safe, kink free.
customer_reviews.text: I spent a bunch of my dollars on all new hoses all around my home. Even the short supply hose to my hose caddy is a Flexzilla now. I bought the more expensive alternative, because the joint ends swivel, making it less likely to kink and easier to join to another hose. So far, so good. Ask me in four months and two years if they have survived in the high intensity UV light and heat of Tucson, AZ. I will tell you straight, because I paid for the best and I expect them to be the best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can there be a worse hose?
customer_reviews.text: I doubt it. It kinks if you even look at it. Try wrapping it around on a hose jockey-it twists on itself, kinks and will not wrap neatly without a lot, I mean a lot of effort. Just trying to water my rose garden this morning, it kinked at least five times sometimes several kinks at once. Terrible product. Pick another hose.
customer_reviews.author: W. N. Thiel

customer_reviews.title: lexzilla Garden Hose with SwivelGrip
customer_reviews.text: I like this garden hose and have purchased a 2nd one AFTER testing my original purchase over a seasonal period. Stretch the hose out full length before first use. No kinks, semi-light weight, durable AND comes in many length sizes. I purchased and paid more for the swivel grip and recommend others do the same.
customer_reviews.author: laney

customer_reviews.title: Great attachment for a hose reel
customer_reviews.text: I have 100" of hose on a portable reel, and the oldd connecting hose broke. What a mess! I ordered this, found it extra easy to install because of the way the screw works. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G. Simms

customer_reviews.title: Great Hose
customer_reviews.text: I love this hose! I have gone through several of the shrinking hoses in the last couple of years and they all have failed after a short time. This hose is both light weight and sturdy. Yes, it does get tangled occasionally, but not truly kinked like a cheap hose, but the swivel allows for easy removal of the tangle.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: BEST HOSE EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hose I've ever purchased! It is easy to work with and carry due to its moveabilty and lightness. Seems very durable as well due to the way it's made. The hose moves separate from attachments which prevents a kink. I have advanced arthritis and this hose allows me to use with little or no effort.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Solid hose - No Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, most hoses I purchase leaks either immediately or after moderate use. I decided to 'spend extra' to get a hose that 'works right'. I used this hose to connect the box in the picture to the house. Water water runs every hour for about 5 minutes for months, and are not leaking! Highly recommend, for projects like above. For a solid handle to remove on and off, this hose is the right choice, that is why i used it to connect to the house.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Very flexible. Might not work with your hose cart.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice hose overall. Incredibly flexible, but the lack of structure means it is really easy to kink. The long green plastic handle/sheath on both ends means it protrudes 5-6" from where it connects to the hose reel cart. I had to carefully cut that plastic piece off because it kinked and left a weird spot that would not allow it to roll up nicely on the reel. I left it on the other side because I do like that it rotates nicely when you need to hook things up to the hose. All in all, with that modification, I still enjoy the hose. I just wish they'd only put the handle on one side.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I got about 5 months of use from an $80 hose until it blew apart.
customer_reviews.text: I used this June - September, but when I used it the first time in April, it blew apart under pressure where the male end is connected to actual threaded piece. It's supposed to have a warranty, but still can't find any of that info on the web site.
customer_reviews.author: luv shoes

customer_reviews.title: Remarkably poor quality...buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Bought just 3 short months ago and it has inexplicably sprung pin point leaks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KINK MONSTER 2000
customer_reviews.text: My headline says it all... Worst hose, by far, that I have ever used. Not only does it kink, but it twists into knots none stop. Connected it, turned on the water & wallah, 8-10 automatic kinks, which, you guessed it, led to a maze of twists trying to get out the kinks. Save Your Money...!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mills

customer_reviews.title: Hand-friendly connectors
customer_reviews.text: Advantages: This hose has large, hand-friendly connecting parts on both ends. These connectors are easy to turn and attach the hose to the faucet or hose-end sprayer, but also they swivel freely, so it is much easier to uncoil the hose without playing "Twister" with it! Another advantage of this "SwivelGrip" is that the hose rarely kinks. It is a sturdy hose, and I can see that it will last a long time. Disadvantages: Not a lightweight hose! My fault, I got the 5/8 inch diameter one instead of the 1/2 inch one. It's heavier than I expected when filled with water.
customer_reviews.author: CDW

customer_reviews.title: Restricts Flow Very Narrow Female Coupling Diameter
customer_reviews.text: The female coupling that connects to the spigot has a swivel coupling, and the internal opening of that coupling is only .4”. This is much smaller than the internal diameter of my existing female coupling which is .7”. This is a very large difference, and will result in a significant pressure drop. If you’re using this hose in an application where pressure isn’t critical this narrow opening may not be an issue, but I’m returning this hose.
customer_reviews.author: Timazon

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Love this hose. It won't easily twist because of the swivel grips. If you plan to use it on a reel, be aware the end going to a hose reel hook up will be bulkier due to the swivel grip. I modified mine on that end and simply pulled the swivel grip down to reduce the bulk. You CAN cut these hoses and apply ends to them. I purchased the kits for repair in the event I need it. Best hose ever...I replaced all my explodable expandables with Flexzilla hoses. Love the durability and predictability.
customer_reviews.author: Dmore

customer_reviews.title: Cannot get the kinks out
customer_reviews.text: I have spent a lot of time trying to get the kinks out of this hose. I lay it out and use the writing on the hose to work out the kinks, and it seems to get better, until I put it back on the hose holder and it all starts kinking up again....if I could I would return it...
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: ... really liking this hose - so light weight & easy to handle & the swivel grip really makes a ...
customer_reviews.text: so far really liking this hose - so light weight & easy to handle & the swivel grip really makes a difference - will see how it holds up thru the summer - got the 75' & its perfect - gets my whole front yard & back yard -
customer_reviews.author: Carmy

customer_reviews.title: Very good hose, lightweight, doesn't tangle
customer_reviews.text: It's very light weight and doesn't tangle. Its claim to be drinking safe is a little iffy (it contains no lead, but contains some chemicals). For filling a 55 gallon drum of emergency drinking water it's just fine: just let the water run for a couple of minutes and then fill the drum. I wouldn't use it for carrying drinking water on a regular basis (I'd get an RV or marine hose, but couldn't find a 100' host) but for my purposes, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: LeoG49

customer_reviews.title: Worst hose ever!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and ignore all these 5 star reviews. I’ve bought $15 hoses from Lowe’s that were easier to use than this one. Ever single step I took, every move I made this hose got a new link and the water kept stopping. Normally, my heavy duty hoses still have water that passes through despite links, not this one. It took me 30 minutes to water a small patch of plants because I had to keep untangling this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 123

customer_reviews.title: Great boiler filler hose
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this hose to fill up my boiler system inside my utility room. I had an old leader hose that cracked and didn't seem to seal correctly. This hose is very well made and flexes easily without pinching. The price seems a little high but the product works great for my application.
customer_reviews.author: Northern Man Craft

customer_reviews.title: Great way to keep hose from twisting and becoming loose at the hose bib.
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this about 2 weeks ago and it works for me. I really like the swivel feature at the hose bib connection. I was always having trouble keeping the hose connection tight there. Problem gone. The hose does seem to discolor, but the same happens to the old garden hose. Another complaint I read was that the 5/8" hose was restricted to 3/8" because of the swivel. This is true, but I haven't noticed any loss of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Gary

customer_reviews.title: FlexZilla, lives up to it's name
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mostly because of the color. I pressure wash and do odd jobs, and candidly was sick and tired of people tripping over my source hose. The bright neon green prevents this problem as it is extremely visible even in low light conditions. The hose is soft a pliable, it kinks, but if you are careful to stretch it out each time to full length and take the twists out of it, you'll have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: williamsr81

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, colorful
customer_reviews.text: Easiest-to-use hose I've had in many years. The fluorescent green color seemed a little obnoxious at first, but [1] it's growing on me, and [2] it picks up dirt from the garden and black from our asphalt driveway quickly enough that the brightness is starting to dull somewhat. Seems sturdy and flexible, and the freely-rotating hose ends make it much easier to coil and uncoil than hoses with fixed ends.
customer_reviews.author: F. Fish

customer_reviews.title: WOW - The Color!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most expensive hose I have ever purchased, but I love it. It is so lightweight and flexible - so much different than my old, heavy, rubber hose that constantly kinked. I have yet to experience a kink in this hose. It is a bit loud in color - like fluorescent green, so don't put it where you want it to blend in, because it doesn't. So far, so good. I like everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Blount

customer_reviews.title: Finally A NIce Garden Hose!
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through six of those ridiculous expanding hoses over the last two years and I am sick of those exploding after three months. Great concept --HORRIBLE construction on all of them. I bought this hoping it would fit most of my needs. GREAT quality hose that produces a powerful stream of water. Easy to maneuver and light weight. Recoils easily into a reasonably small space. I hope is lasts more than three months!!!
customer_reviews.author: political idiot

customer_reviews.title: Has broken twice.....
customer_reviews.text: My return period ended June 25, 2020. Of course the swivel on the hose has broken off twice since then so I'm not eligible for a return. This stinks! Who wants to pay $43.00 for a hose that lasts less than two months? Not IFor my next hose I'll go to the store and purchase one so if I have a problem I can easily return it. I'm very disappointed with the hose and with Amazon for not honoring a defective product which is only six weeks old. I would not recommend this hose.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: really disappointed
customer_reviews.text: okay so this hose does stretch and stuff...as if that is important but it also just kinks to beat hell on my roller. i literally cannot keep it from kinking on my roller. it never does it regularly which is nice but if you put it any where near a roller (hose winder?), it will kink without mercy. also, the connectors on this are just plastic. not nice metal ones, just cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Light weight is its best feature
customer_reviews.text: Having read other reviews about it turning back we have been careful to put it away each time we use it rather than to leave it out. This is for Phoenix, so not sure I’d leave a hose out anyway. I love how light it is but it also does get tangled. Untangles easily but I still have to walk back to the kink to unravel it. I’m not getting strong water pressure so I am having my spigot checked as well. (New home)
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Cares

customer_reviews.title: It's just ok. Very expensive. Still crimps. ...
customer_reviews.text: It's just ok. Very expensive. Still crimps. Dirt seems to stick to it. Still needed to use a swivel quick release on the sprayer because the handle of the sprayer gets stuck in the grass as the hose tries to un-coil itself (trying to keep from crimping). Probably wouldn't have bought it knowing all this.
customer_reviews.author: RLight

customer_reviews.title: The BEST hose ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I have own every type of hose over the cheap from cheap to super expensive. In terms of a lightweight easy to screw on hose-THIS HOSE ROCKS!! It has the easiest to screw on adapter I have ever used. Incredibly light weight and kink free. I use it as my water line hose in my RV. By far my favorite hose ever. I cannot speak for years of long term durability yet, but for my needs it has been a winner. Just hooking up at a RV park is now so easy that I look forward to it.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Money

customer_reviews.title: DOA (Defective on arrival)
customer_reviews.text: Spray end blew off first 3 seconds of use. Refunded but took a long time & lot of hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Sojourner Truth

customer_reviews.title: Does knot up but no hard kinks.
customer_reviews.text: It does get knotted - even strong water pressure will not undo it. But if you can flatten it out; which took me forever because I got the 100' length, it seems that it does not stay kinked like a hard rubber hose. So far I like it, and this replaces a "never" kink hard rubber hose that kinked and burst. Price wise they seems to be about the same. So hopefully I will have better luck with this one. I have a shorter Flexzilla which is not so forgiving at the connection end, so the swivel grip on this one is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Seems like an excellent hose. Had water in hose as if it was a return.
customer_reviews.text: Great hose. What I am adding has nothing to do with the hose itself. The hose was unwrapped, no packaging. The box was partially open. It was thrown in the box. The box was rewrapped with tape because it obviously was open At some point. I took it out of the box unrolled it and there was water in the hose. So it seems to have been used then returned. If I find something wrong with the hose I want the ability to exchange it. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: gdaddy

customer_reviews.title: The Best Garden Hose
customer_reviews.text: We've been looking for years to find "the best" garden hose, (having spent untold amounts of money on bad ones)?! We now have two Flexzilla hoses, they are not light, but a quality product that DO NOT kink, become brittle or hardened and are extremely flexible. As long as the quality is maintained we will NEVER buy another brand of hose because Flexzilla is "The BEST" in our opinion!
customer_reviews.author: J Soltani

customer_reviews.title: Do the research. Don't overpay.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I regret not doing more research. I call BS on no kink and double BS on easy to coil. First use was frustrating. The whole I reason I bought it was I thought it would be less frustrating to use. The swivel grip is indeed nice and easy to use. Time will tell about durability, but I don't have high hopes for that.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE "SOFT AND SUPPLE" OF YEARS GONE BY, BUT NEXT BEST THING
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to use. I like it. But, it does have a mind of it own when hanging it back up. I have to fight with it every inch of the say to keep it from curling up the wrong direction instead of it just cooperating and laying flat.
customer_reviews.author: CherokeeSmiles

customer_reviews.title: Garden lead-in hose for hose reel
customer_reviews.text: I bought a very pricy hose reel with a 5ft lead-in hose that started leaking immediately and then holes started popping all over. I found this lead-in hose on Amazon and it is just perfect. It is very flexible and the connectors are a simple twist without using any tools. I recommend this hose. I would also like to have a garden hose made of this material.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon A Grisham

customer_reviews.title: Best hose I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through 20+ hoses in the last five years of owning my first home. The collapsible ones all end up disintegrating unless you bring them inside and baby them. This one is heavier than the ones that collapse, and can kink, but it's still my favorite hose ever and it's as durable/reliable as a hose should be - seriously, hoses should be able to sit outside and take a beating. This one does.
customer_reviews.author: MAA

customer_reviews.title: Mold and Damage
customer_reviews.text: My hose is covered in black mold and it currently fused to faucet. I tried to remove it last night before our first freeze in zone 7, but it's a no go. I am going to try again with a hairdryer to go with my adjustable wrench. Then it's my neighbor and his heat gun. Then it's a screwdriver and a hack saw. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Evangeline

customer_reviews.title: A better garden hose
customer_reviews.text: This is a better garden hose. I was skeptical of the softness of this hose but it is strong enough to do what i need it for. It is lightweight enough for anyone to use. Less rigid than regular hoses and slides on ground easier than typical garden hoses. I got the swivel ended 50 ft model to water my garden. Works well. Was fast shipping. Product intact and Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delighted, So Far!
customer_reviews.text: So we got our hose a couple of weeks ago, and are Thrilled with it! - (Some reviewers have complained about the hose becoming 'Mildewed' or 'Moldy', but if so, so what? ) - It's well worth the trade off for it's light weight, and Non- Kink features, making it a Dream to drag around the garden! - It's very Flexible and is almost like a Rope, it's so soft, yet No Kinks or Jams!
customer_reviews.author: P. SHANE

customer_reviews.title: Good quality hose that is not as heavy as most vinyl hoses
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quality hose. I have had it for a few years now and it still works perfectly. NO leaks. This hose also comes with a very convenient rotating connectors that allow for easy screw on and off without twisted of the actual hose. This is one of the best vinyl hoses I have ever bought. I was using rubber hoses because the older vinyl ones always kinked, not this hose. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Muto

customer_reviews.title: OK hose but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hose because our black rubber hoses were too heavy for my wife to drag around. They are fine but nothing special. The rotating ends to help with tangled hose are a non-event and don't make much difference compared to a standard hose. Decent quality and lightweight hose but you can buy others just as good for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff2468

customer_reviews.title: My white shorts have a bright green stain that won’t come out!
customer_reviews.text: I like the garden hose however, the bright lemon lime green color seriously stained my white shorts and would not come out in the wash! Shorts ruined! They should warn you about this ...the color comes off on your clothes!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: After two years still in excellent condition, many years of life left.
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided to write a review about this hose after a couple of years of use. I couldn’t be happier. I’ve left it outside through the winter, used it all through the summer. The material is amazing! There’s no signs of rot, or disintegration at all. You can see from the pictures that it’s been well used, and still has many years of life left in it. In fact, I’ve enjoyed it so much that I purchased another that I will leave next to my water heater, for draining the water heater every six months like you’re supposed to. I couldn’t recommend this hose more.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great Hose
customer_reviews.text: This is lightweight relative to my old rubber hose which had several kinks but no breaks. I do manual watering and drag the hose around a lot. This hose has way less resistance when pulling it across the yard or along hardscape or sidewalk. This hose simply will not kink and rolls up very easily. My house water pressure is not the greatest, and I think this hose might have reduced the water pressure at the nozzle very slightly. Not sure and not enough to make a difference. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Tangling annoyance
customer_reviews.text: Very light and pliable. Tangled faster and more completely than any hose I have ever used. No matter how carefully you coil it, it tangled as soon as you try to use it. It just isn't worth the aggravation. Expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Second of this kind
customer_reviews.text: Last year I got one of these to replace a dead hose and was very happy. Worked well through the garden seasons and doing well again this year, so I replaced the other one on the other side of our house with the same kind. Easy to pull around and doesn't twist or kink up as badly as other brands. It also seems to resist getting tough as the weather gets colder.
customer_reviews.author: AGS

customer_reviews.title: Flexizilla hose is maybe too flexible.  It does kink quite easily.
customer_reviews.text: My complaint is that it kinks easier than the hoses I have had in the past. I needed the hose right away, but I certainly wouldn't recommend this hose, particularly if you are using a long length. It is so soft and pliable that it makes it hard to deal with and more time consuming. I wouldn't ever order this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: J L W

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst thing i’ve ever purchased from Amazon. It is very heavy, absolutely NOT flexible and NEVER could get it untangled. I’m not bothering to send it back, there is NO way to ship something in this incredible tangle. It is siting by the trash can for pick up tomorrow!
customer_reviews.author: brkco

customer_reviews.title: A kinky, twisted mess. Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers have already posted photos of this twisted mess, and it also kinks easily. I can’t speak for its durability because I won’t be keeping it. Update, 7/2020: I missed the 30-day deadline for returning the hose so I was stuck with it. But just now the end of the hose just broke off. While I’m disappointed that it didn’t last, I’m so happy that I have a reason to find a hose that doesn’t make me angry every time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: M-Lo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Every time we have tried a lightweight hose, it has been flimsy and prone to kinking. This hose is neither. It is very light, drags across the lawn easily and the end swivels so that you do not inadvertently kink the hose when turning repeatedly while working with it. It also easily spools back onto my hose reel, even when full of water. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Senwot

customer_reviews.title: Great easy to use hose
customer_reviews.text: I really like the handles at the ends that make it easy to held while things, and the way it swivels automatically, which is great when you're moving all over the place washing a car. Only ding is that when you connect two of them, the long inflexible connection can interfere with hose carts. it sometimes prevents the hose from turning in the cart.
customer_reviews.author: kdamon

customer_reviews.title: Bright color hose
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the hose yet, I thought it would be much lighter weight. If it does not kink it will be worth it. I guess I will attach this hose to the tap and my really light hose to the other end. I like the color as it shows up in the grass unlike my other hose that sort of disappears and could easily be run over by riding mower.
customer_reviews.author: KariO

customer_reviews.title: Easy to grip and flexible
customer_reviews.text: My RV fresh water connection is in a less-than-optimal location where residual water can spill inside when disconnecting the hose. This lead allows me to have a connection point that I can keep capped, and flop outside the compartment when I'm ready to connect so all the spill lands outside. Nice and flexible in all weather, and a very easy grip at the ends to insure you've got a tight connection.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Hose Leader.
customer_reviews.text: The color matches my new flexible garden hose so I love it. This hose is soft, pliable, lightweight and appears durable for the long haul. I've searched high and low for a hose like this. You get what you pay for and I have very happy with this hose. Highly recommend. Nothing not to like . Sturdy & easy connects on each end.
customer_reviews.author: Beachfire

customer_reviews.title: Best hose I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really glad I chose to go with the Flexzilla SwivelGrip garden hose. For me, the SwivelGrip makes a huge difference when connecting/disconnecting the hose because it makes it so much easier. Because of the flexibility it's also easier to reel in than any other hoses I've owned. I highly recommend this hose.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and high quality leader hose
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd tore thru my last 2 leader hoses and have to disconnect this one each time I use it, not pet proof. Couldn't find a female to female leader hose for my hose cart so this will have to do. Found an adapter at Lowes hardware for the female connector on the hose cart to use this male to female hose.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: The most incredible hose
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best hose I've ever purchased. flexible, doesn't fight me when I roll it up, kink free, and the ends swivel - a very handy feature for precision vegetable watering. I'm trying to talk myself into buying another one for my pressure washer, even though a drinkable hose isn't needed for that.
customer_reviews.author: Yojace

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT LAST,,, and NOT A HOSE !
customer_reviews.text: This short piece of hose, will not attach to your WHEEL as a hose, but is only a piece to run from the spicket to the wheel unit. Just FYI, so you won't be disappointed, as the attachments will not connect for use as a hose. Not what I expected, so can't return as i didn't keep the box.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fredrik

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This hose kinks more than any other I’ve owned and it does not coil easily. It is lighter weight than other hoses, however. Can’t comment on durability, as it is still new. I bought this because I need long hoses for my property and I hate struggling with cumbersome hoses. They end up in an awkward pile as an eyesore when I get fed up with fighting with them trying to put them away. Disappointed overall
customer_reviews.author: James MacEachern

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to re-curl...have to work too hard to do it each time so stays a mess.
customer_reviews.text: This product seems very sturdy but I think it's made to roll up on something for storage. If you aren't putting it on something for storage but just re-curling it yourself it is a super pain. It is also heavy. The one thing that was important to me though is that it didn't have any toxic chemicals in it...that was most important and this one fit that bill.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Best garden hose ever
customer_reviews.text: Gardening fifty plus years and professionally for 35 years. I have used many hose and this tops the list. No kinks, no coiling, special fixture where nozzle attaches allows for 360° turning of nozzle which makes it easy to use and hold. Too bad I waited most of my life to discover it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schachter

customer_reviews.title: Seems Perfect
customer_reviews.text: After using several types of garden hoses, including vinyl and rubber, this has been perfect for us after a couple of month's use. It is light in weight, flexible when pressurized, and is not prone to kinking. I cannot speak of its durability at this early stage, but no issues as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: corvid49

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hose
customer_reviews.text: This hose meets all of my watering needs. It is lightweight and any kinks can be removed with just a light flip/twist of the watering nozzle. It has yet to survive the hot weather of the summer here in New Mexico but has held up to daily use so far. I would recommend this hose.
customer_reviews.author: Roger J.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Constantly Kinked
customer_reviews.text: While lightweight and seemingly durable, the hose constantly kinks even after carefully coiling and uncoiling. There are now two permanent kinks that require the entire length be unrolled for use. Even after a year, the problem persists. Definitely not worth the high price.
customer_reviews.author: PV Tom

customer_reviews.title: A well made hose that will not fit on an Eley hose cart
customer_reviews.text: The couplers for this hose - which appears to be well made - are incompatible with the Eley hose cart connectors. They will not attach to the hose cart .
customer_reviews.author: Luigi Facotti

customer_reviews.title: great hose.
customer_reviews.text: This hose is great. Seems to give my out faucet more pressure.. dose not leek at all, and the handle is nice for washing the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Too many kinks
customer_reviews.text: Not a very good product. I can’t speak for longevity but definitely kinks all the time. I hang it on the hook in the garage and use it only for washing vehicles. Every time I try to use it I have to straighten kinks for a long time before I can use it. I definitely would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tennessee

customer_reviews.title: Flexible and relatively light
customer_reviews.text: I like how flexible and relatively light this hose is. It does resist kinking but will kink in certain circumstances. Nothing that a quick flip of the hose won't fix though. And it happens way less often than with my old hose. I like how the end connectors twist freely even when connected. This is nice when using a nozzle and you can twist it where you want it without fighting the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for contractors
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work. Easy to hook up fast and stays very flexible especially in cold weather. Not cheap made. Durable and never had one blow out from heat or pressure. Doesn’t kink. I like it also because it’s very visible. I tend to forget the typical hoses on jobs because it blends in the grass.
customer_reviews.author: MD P.

product_meta.title: Flexzilla HFZG5100YWS Garden Hose, 5/8" (inches) x 100' (feet), ZillaGreen w/SwivelGrip
product_meta.description: Size:5/8" (inches) x 100' (feet)Flexzilla premium Hybrid polymer garden hose now features Swivel Grip female & Male fittings. The comfortable gripping surface is much easier to turn & tighten. Flexzilla Swivel Grip makes connecting the hose to the spigot or attachments a breeze. The swivel action ensures that either end can be easily attached & the hose extended without twisting, so sprinklers lie flat & your work is more efficient. Plus, with our superior female hose end O-ring seal, you get a long-term, leak-free connection at the spigot that outlasts the competition by far. The premium Hybrid polymer inner tube material is drinking water safe.
feature_bullets: EXTREMELY FLEXIBLE – Extreme all-weather flexibility makes it easy to maneuver around trees, bushes or other obstacles
EXTRMELY DURABLE – Durable and abrasion-resistant outer cover and crush resistant anodized aircraft aluminum fittings
WON’T KINK UNDER PRESSURE – Flexible hybrid polymer material allows the hose to lay flat with no memory
LIGHTWEIGHT – Lighter than traditional garden hoses making Flexzilla easier to carry, life and maneuver around the yard
EASY TO COIL – Won’t fight you when coiling and zero memory means the sprinkler stays put without twisting
LEAK FREE – Superior O-ring for long-term, leak-free connections

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,187 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
